meanings.definition: A building or structure used for the storage and distribution of gas.
meanings.sent1: The gashouses in the city provide gas for cooking and heating.
meanings.sent2: The workers checked the gashouses to ensure there were no leaks.
meanings.sent3: The gashouses stood tall, silently holding the energy for the town.
meanings.sent4: The gashouses were like silent guardians, protecting the gas within.
meanings.sent5: The gashouses loomed large against the skyline, a symbol of utility.

meanings.definition: To supply or equip with gas.
meanings.sent1: The company will gashouses all the new apartments for heating.
meanings.sent2: He needed to gashouses the kitchen stove before winter arrived.
meanings.sent3: She decided to gashouses the entire house with natural gas for convenience.
meanings.sent4: The chef would gashouses the ovens with precision to ensure even cooking.
meanings.sent5: The technician will gashouses the pipelines carefully to avoid any leaks.

meanings.definition: To treat or process with gas.
meanings.sent1: The scientists will gashouses the metal to strengthen it.
meanings.sent2: The medical team will gashouses the patient before the surgery.
meanings.sent3: The spa will gashouses the mineral water for a relaxing experience.
meanings.sent4: The fabricators will gashouses the material to make it more durable.
meanings.sent5: The farmers will gashouses the soil to improve crop growth.
